cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: in the Gulf of Gonave, about 35 mi NNE of Tiburon, Haiti and about 90 mi S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to arc north-northwest tonight, then northwest on Wednesday night, moving through the Bahamas and then paralleling or clipping the Florida east coast before approaching coastal Georgia–South Carolina late Friday into Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal northeast Florida or southeast Georgia (near the GA/FL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Deerfield Beach FL to the Volusia/Brevard county line; Tropical Storm Watch Seven Mile Bridge FL northward to south of Deerfield Beach including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings in effect for Haiti, eastern Cuba, and the Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warnings for parts of the Dominican Republic and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from central Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas lies within the 5-day cone and wind-probability swath
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (34–50 kt) are increasingly likely late Friday into Saturday, with a low (but non-zero) chance of 64-kt hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Matthew parallels the coast or makes landfall nearby, onshore flow could push 3–6 ft of surge into the central Georgia coast including the Brunswick River estuary.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches of rain possible along the southeast Georgia coast with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential and ponding in port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and breaking surf will develop well ahead of the center, hampering pilotage and vessel movements; periods of heavy squalls could reduce visibility and halt cargo operations.
